news_header: Taiwanese President Lai Ching-te asserts Taiwan's territorial integrity during a visit to the Kinmen islands, emphasizing the importance of defending democracy and freedom.
news_text: During a visit to the Kinmen islands, Taiwanese President Lai Ching-te declared that Taiwan would not concede any territory, reaffirming the islands' significance in the context of the Battle of Guningtou's 75th anniversary. He emphasized the need to defend democracy and freedom, stating that external forces would not alter the islands' future. Lai's remarks come amid tensions with China, which considers Taiwan part of its territory and has threatened military action. The Kinmen and Matsu islands have been under Taiwanese control since the Republic of China government retreated there in 1949.
